title: Kraft Philadelphia logo typeface
content:
Hi all,

Just wondering what the typeface used in the Kraft Philadelphia logo is. Perhaps while you're at it, you could help me out with the Kraft logo itself? Cheers.

[http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/brands/0014/3673/brand.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229210434/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/brands/0014/3673/brand.gif)
author: benski

comments.content: The "Philadelphia" remind me of ITC Franklin Gothic Demi Extra Compressed. But if I remember right, the P and the A are different.

Hereâ€™s an older thread about the KRAFT logo:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/31890](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229210434/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31890 "http://www.typophile.com/node/31890")

My vote, if I were trying to replicate it, would be Font Bureau's [Agenda Bold Ultra Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229210434/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/agenda/), but these are such 'neutral' letters that I suspect many sans serif families could work. The counter on the P is about the only earmark of note in this lettering. If you get close, and have the right color blue, it would be hard to tell the difference.

- Mike Yanega
